name: Hyde Park - Walk to UChicago/Metra to McCormick Pl
summary: Be the sole guest in a quiet, vintage, 2nd floor coop apartment - just one block from the eastern border of the University of Chicago campus. This apartment is across the street from Chicago Theological Seminary (which houses Bexley Seabury) and a 10 min Metra train ride to McCormick Place. The Hyde Park location is easily accessible by public transportation (or shared car service) to/from both Midway and O’Hare Airports.
space: The private bedroom has a queen size bed, chest, desk and Smart TV. The large closet contains plenty of hangers, an iron and ironing board, a clothes steamer, and extra bedding. There is room in the closet to store your luggage.  All bedding (including mattress pad and duvet cover) is freshly laundered for each guest. During extended stays, weekly housekeeping is provided to the guest room - at no additional charge. The bathroom (shared only with the host) is stocked with clean towels, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and bar soap, mouthwash and a guest hair dryer. Space is provided in the bathroom for guest to store personal toiletries.

neighborhood_overview: My apartment is located one block from beautiful Jackson Park which houses the Museum of Science and Industry, Omnimax Theater, Space Center and the Osaka Garden - built in 1893 for the World's Colombian Exposition. Theaters, restaurants, grocery and book stores, and lakefront bicycle/walking paths and a sandy beach are within walking distance.
notes: The basement laundry room hours are 8:00am to 10:00pm. There are 2 front-loading washers, 2 dryers, and a table for folding your clothes.  Laundry products for your use are located in the laundry room on a shelf labeled with my name.
transit: UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO: Visiting academics and doctors may use the temporary ID provided by the school to catch the FREE UChicago shuttle bus in front of the Metra station located next door. The UChicago shuttle routes are available on the university website. (Refer to maps in this listing for distances to campus locations). SEMINARIES: The Chicago Theological Seminary building - which houses Bexley Seabury Seminary -  is a 7 minute walk.  MCCORMICK PLACE: McCormick Place is a 10 minute Metra Electric train ride away - 16 minutes door-to-door from my apartment! Refer to Metra website for timetable.  DOWNTOWN: The CTA #6 bus to the Loop, Grant Park, and Millennium Park stops less than a block away. You can also take the Metra Electric train for an even faster trip downtown.  FREE PARKING: Free street parking is available 24 hours a day. There are no meters but be aware of the following Chicago parking restrictions: 1. DO NOT park in the 1 clearly marked handicap spot in front of my build
access: You will have access to the entire apartment (with the exception of the host’s bedroom) including use of the kitchen - should you decide to prepare meals during your stay.
interaction: I will greet you when you arrive and show you around the apartment. If I am not available, you will receive self-check-in instructions prior to your arrival.  Feel free to message me via Airbnb if you have any questions before or during your stay. You will receive a prompt response.
house_rules: 1. Your booking is for ONE (1) person only. You may not exceed the number of people specified at the time of booking. 2. No 3rd party bookings are allowed.  3. Smoking is prohibited in all common areas of the building (stairwells, porches, vestibules, laundry room, etc).  4. The tenants in the building observe quiet hours (no loud noises, loud music or laundry usage) from 10:00pm to 7:00am.  5. Chicago area residents may not use Instant Booking to reserve this listing. 6. The internet may not be used for illegal activity.  7. Lost or non-returned keys may incur a $50 locksmith charge.
host_about:
My 2 bdrm apartment is a 2nd floor walk-up in a quiet, vintage co-op building, overlooking a pleasant courtyard.  I allow only one guest so you don't have to worry about other strangers in the apartment. (I occupy the 2nd bedroom).  A single traveler will feel safe and be comfortable here. If you are visiting the University of Chicago - or visiting your UChicago student who hasn't enough room to host you - my location will allow you to walk to your destination. My apartment is probably the Airbnb listing most convenient to the Chicago Theological Seminary address. 

If you have been skeptical about  trying Airbnb, you will be pleasantly surprised at how drama-free the experience can be. The key is to read the listing (including house rules) and the reviews, then select a place that meets your safety, location, and comfort needs.

Let me know the purpose of your trip to Chicago so I can help you determine if my apartment or Hyde Park location is (or isn't) right for your visit.  I may even be able to suggest a more appropriate location. In any event, I will answer your inquiries quickly and honestly.

name: We're back. 365 Great Reviews.  1 bad one.
summary: We took the winter off, made things nicer around here. Pictures have not been updated yet, but trust us, it's definitely nicer.  Re-opening March 1, 2019. Across the street from CTA train. Runs every 6-10 minutes most of the day, 8-14 minutes late night, best way to get around.  Now another reason to stay here: Lagunitas Brewery and Taproom. If you like beer, it's heaven. Seriously.
space: We travel a lot, we know what people need.  We've been doing this a while, we know what people want. Simply put, we do it right.  The reviews speak for themselves.  You can rent an entirely furnished, really cool, comfortable apartment designed for travelers, for a great price. It's a really nice, really big place for one person, big enough for 7 persons (but ONLY one bathroom). Nobody lives in the apartment, it's used solely for vacation rental guests, so it's not full of other people's stuff that you have to deal with.  There is always someone upstairs (well not Always, we go out during the day a lot) if you need anything or have any problems, questions, etc. We should warn you, we watch the house very protectively: unauthorized overnight guests will be charged $50 per person per night. The house was built in 1893. That's old in Chicago. It's a large, clean apartment in a large, old house, across the street from a CTA pink line train, so close you can set your watch by it. house_rules: Don't sit around all day watching T.V. Don't hesitate to ask for whatever you need. Don't be pigs, don't be assholes. It's OK to be stupid to a certain degree. Get out there and enjoy the city.
host_about: Incredibly creative(Kathleen) and stunningly amusing/disturbing(Craig) Chicago artists who have to work for a living. Dog and cat unemployed. As good Chicagoans, all four of us support Obama (Hillary), so if you're Republican, you might want to stay somewhere else, ...like, uh, maybe Kentucky. Just to clarify, we've been to Kentucky and it's a very nice place to visit.  Would never live there.

name: Tiny Studio Apartment 94 Walk Score
summary: A very small studio in a wonderful neighborhood.
space: This is a very small  studio apartment with a private entrance.  The apartment is located on the rear half of our first floor. It has its own entrance. It consists of a kitchen and a small bedroom with a queen sized bed (new since October 2016) and bathroom with a tub and shower.  There is a kitchen with a stove and mini fridge and sink and microwave plus a small table for two. We have a Roku Box for tv watching and excellent cable internet. The Roku has Amazon Prime, Netflix and a bunch of other channels. We have hi-speed Comcast internet  I teach an Airbnb Experience in Soapmaking upstairs in my apartment, so let me know if you want to schedule a class at your convenience while you are here! notes: We really like our neighbors and want guests to respect their space. You can't smoke in their yard, hang out on their front porch, ring their bell and ask for help, etc. Please do not bother our neighbors. They are nice people who we wish to maintain a good relationship with. And they don't have spare keys or know how to use the lock box.

interaction: My family lives in the building but we are not home 24/7. We are available to answer questions, especially via email.  Guests let themselves in with a key code and generally have total privacy from us unless they need help with anything.
house_rules: This is a tiny apartment and is only appropriate for one or two people. Check out is  flexible if no one is arriving the next day. If someone is arriving we ask you to be out at 11 am on the dot. You can come early but only if no one is there the night before and you have arranged this with us in advance. Otherwise check in is at 2 pm.
host_about: We live in Chicago. We love to travel and see the world with our two children!

name: Barbara's Hideaway - Old Town
summary: One-bedroom hideaway tucked into Old Town steps from Lincoln Park, the zoo, and the lakefront path. World-class dining and shopping surrounds you. Full kitchen and bathroom, queen bed, baby grand piano, lovely patio, washer and dryer, much more!
description: One-bedroom hideaway tucked into Old Town steps from Lincoln Park, the zoo, and the lakefront path. World-class dining and shopping surrounds you. Full kitchen and bathroom, queen bed, baby grand piano, lovely patio, washer and dryer, much more! This lovely one bedroom
neighborhood_overview: Chicago’s Old Town neighborhood is squeezed between the edges of Lincoln Park, Goose Island, and the Gold Coast, about a mile north of The Loop. This cozy neighborhood of tree-lined streets and old victorian-era buildings oozes an old Chicago feel, from it’s well-heeled restaurants and taverns to its thriving theatre and performance scene. This affluent, historic neighborhood is notably home to one of only seven churches that survived the Great Chicago Fire, St. Michael’s Church. The neighborhood is great for strolling around, one of the most dense and walkable in the city. The Old Town Art Fair is one of Chicago’s most popular street festivals. Each June more than 250 artists display work of all mediums at the fair, which also hosts live music, a garden walk, and tours of the historic neighborhood. Old Town is also home to a wide array of small independent boutiques, though you’ll also find familiar names and restaurants within its boundaries. All of this adds up to what (URL HIDDEN)
notes: Vacation rental tax of 21.4 required in addition to nightly rate and cleaning fee *** (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
transit: Public transit in Chicago is excellent, and although the systems are easy to use, using the CTA website ((URL HIDDEN) or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Maps for trip planning is always a good idea. (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Maps is very accurate for Chicago Public Transit - it’s what we use.   A one-way train or bus fare is $2.25 per person. If you intend to use public transit multiple times throughout your trip, consider an unlimited 3 day or 7 day pass.  These are available at any CVS Pharmacy or Walgreens. On the CTA Red Line Get off at (transfer to the Brown Line at Belmont or Fullerton): Chicago: The Gold Coast, Water Tower Place, Hancock, and the Magnificent Mile. Grand:  Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile,Riverwalk, Chicago Riverboat Architecture Tours Monroe, Jackson:  Art Institute of Chicago and Grant Park Harrison, Jackson, Roosevelt:  Grant Park Roosevelt: Museum Campus, including the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Adler Planetarium, Soldier Field Monroe:  Millenium Park, The Bean,
interaction: We're always here for our guests.  We have an emergency contact number available 24/7.
host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing throughout the city in or near Old Town and Lincoln Park.

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City. Wicker Park is a frequent hangout, where we tend to be pulled to the patio at Big Star, the bar at XOCO, and cocktails at Violet Hour. 

And free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

name: 3 Comforts of Cooperative Living
summary: The condo is the 2nd floor in a lovely 1912 3-flat that needs some loving care. The neighborhood is tree-lined and beautiful. The room is light and quiet with a bathroom shared with up to 3 other bedrooms. Renovation in the condo is incomplete, but most rooms are user-ready.  We're having the wood molding, floor, doors, and trim stripped, refinished, and sealed, starting soon.
space: Newly furnished with queen bed and the comforts from my grandma to you.  Anyone staying more than 21 days is expected to provide their own consumables (soap, shampoo, bathroom tissue, etc.)  We are able to keep the prices low by having everyone clean up after themselves during their stay.  The weekly chore chart can be found on the frig.   Pick up after yourself and be courtious of condo-mates.  Special attention is needed in the kitchen and bathroom.

neighborhood_overview: It's a 10 minute walk from the lakefront bike and running path and several beaches. There are city rental bikes available on the way to the bike path. Hyde Park is the home of the University of Chicago,the Museum of Science and Industry, the Court Theater, the Smart Gallery, the Renaissance Gallery, and the Hyde Park Art Center, as well as President Obama’s residence.
notes: If you stay longer than 21 days you are expected to participate in the chore chart (on frig) and provide your own consumables (bathroom tissue, laundry soap, paper towels, etc.).  This is a cooperative, community-living condo.  We are able to keep prices low by EVERYONE pitching in and being courteous to your condo-mates. Maintenance issues should be reported to us as they come up so we can address them.  This is an older building which requires frequent care.
transit: It is a short walk to public transportation that will take you downtown in 15 minutes (the Metra train, and the#6 and #2 Express buses to the Loop).
access: Pantry has non-perishable food for use by house guests.  Use of Washer/Dryer, use of all common spaces (Kitchen, formal Dining room, sitting room, bathroom.  Secured WIFI, cable, kitchen and cooking privileges included.
interaction: I travel a lot for work so you may not see me at all during your stay. When I am in Hyde Park I like to share meals and have easy conversations.  We are curious about the places our guests come from.  Please add your information to the wall maps.
house_rules: No smoking in the condo.  I only rent to adults and their charges (if you bring kids with you... you are responsible that they follow the rules).  Your Mama isn't here so... clean up after yourself and be courteous to your condo mates.
host_about: A person who is a master in the art of living makes little distinction between their work and their play, their labor and their leisure, their mind and their body, their education and their recreation, their love and their religion. They hardly know which is which and simply pursue their vision of excellence and grace, whatever they do, leaving others to decide whether they are working or playing. To them, they are always doing both.
Everyone is entitled to his opinion, but not to his own facts

host_about.name: The Biddle House (#1)
host_about.summary: Beautiful first floor apartment in Historic Old Town. Tree-lined street,  walking distance to countless wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront.  Beyond Charming, Two-bedroom unit, with one queen and one double, a full kitchen and bathroom.
host_about.space: This 1st floor apartment has a queen size bed in one bedroom and a double in the other bedroom. The bathroom has a bathtub and shower. The apartment includes high speed internet (wi-fi) cable tv, private phone lines, and a complimentary washer and dryer in the building.  Public transportation is terrific from this location; you can take the train (brown line) downtown in just 10 minutes!  You'll be a short walk from the Lincoln Park Zoo, Chicago History Museum, world-famous Second City, great restaurants and bars like Twin Anchors (an old Sinatra hangout), Old Town Social, and Marges.  Max occupancy per apartment is 5. Closest major intersection is North Avenue and Sedgwick Street.

host_about.name: Lincoln Park Guest House
host_about.space: Luxurious and modern accommodations in the heart of Chicago’s hottest neighborhood: Lincoln Park – perfect for business or leisure travelers. This beautiful king suite overlooks DePaul University and is at the spot center of a vibrant, upscale and historic neighborhood noted for its plenitude of retail boutiques, fantastic eateries, live theatre, jazz clubs, and coffee shops.  Quick transportation to The Loop, Millennium Park, McCormick Place and the Magnificent Mile. Accessible by CTA trains from both Chicago airports. The private guest suite features a two-story cathedral ceiling with skylight, king bed is upholstered in leather with a memory foam pillow top mattress and premium Vera Wang linens. Private bath with personal amenities; hair dryer, iron and ironing board. A mini-refrigerator is stocked with bottled water and sodas or juices and Keurig machine available for coffees and tea.

host_about.neighborhood_overview: The Guest House is in the heart of Chicago's most popular neighborhood: Lincoln Park, next to DePaul University, walking distance to scores of fabulous boutiques, restaurants, live theatre, music venues, parks, and a 10-15 minute taxi or CTA train ride to the Loop, Millennium Park and Magnificent Mile. Fullerton Station, a major CTA train stop is two blocks away. It's all happening in Chicago's hottest neighborhood: walk a few blocks to the Steppenwolf Theatre (featuring Hollywood's finest) or shop in the city's best boutiques.
host_about.transit: We a short two blocks from a major CTA station: The Fullerton Station, which serves the Red, Brown and Purple Lines to every point in the city. We are also within one block of several major bus routes: Halsted 08, Lincoln 11 and the Fullerton. There are multiple Divvy bicycle stations within 1 and 2 blocks of the Guest House. Our guests love to use those in the spring, summer and fall seasons. We are just minutes via taxi or train from the Loop, Magnificent Mile, Millennium Park, Wrigley Field and more.
host_about.access: Common area entry, sitting room.
host_about.interaction: Minimal interaction. We always greet hosts personally and show them the room and details. We also gladly respond to any questions and offer suggestions for touring, dining and shopping in the area. We live on-site, refresh the room daily, and are available to be contacted 24/7 via text or mobile. I.e., will bring a bucket of ice to your room, extra linens as needed, etc.
host_about.house_rules: No smoking. Unregistered guests may not be entertained in the house. Guests may not bring alcohol on the premises; however, some exceptions apply, and for those we gladly provide wine bottle opener and wine glasses.
host_about.host_about:
Best in the city with long-time urban-dwelling hosts available to give you the skinny on most things Chicago, while allowing you complete privacy in your own large, separate suite area, accessed via a private stairway.

Luxurious and pristine accommodations with a modern décor in the heart of Chicago’s Lincoln Park – perfect for business or leisure travelers. Located in the spot center of lively city life, it is minutes from the Loop, Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park.

host_about.neighborhood_overview: Our home overlooks the park and is on a quiet, safe and peaceful street. Just a block or two away, the excitement picks up with restaurants, bars, art galleries, cross-fit gyms, a huge library, shopping, and so much more.  The heart of Chicago and Lake Michicagn are just a few minutes away by bus or subway, and on nice days a walk or bike ride is a great way to explore the city from our home. The park across the street is massive with softball fields, basketball court, indoor pool & fitness center, and a brand new playground for the kids to enjoy. We're located in the middle of 5 tremendous neighborhoods with plenty of new spaces and places to explore. You won't be disappointed.  Come enjoy Chicago and make our home your Home Base.
host_about.notes: We love our place and wish we could be there more often.  Work has us traveling non-stop. Families with infants and children have enjoyed staying at our home as well as those of all ages seeking the excitement of Chicago or working in town for clients or spending time with family.
host_about.transit: Public transportation is easy to find.  We have a car but never use it when we are in town.  Chicago Public Transportation 'CTA' is the way to travel! The Chicago Ave bus stops a few steps down the block. The Milwaukee Ave bus is a 4 minute walk. The Chicago 'EL' Blue Line is also a 4 minute walk.  You are 2 stops (3 minute ride) from the heart of downtown Chicago at Clark & Lake. Just a 25 minute 'EL' ride straight to O'Hare International Airport. Taxis are also easily found on Chicago Ave.  Uber and Lyft are everywhere and come right to your door.  If you have vehicles, we have reserved private parking spaces for 2 cars.
host_about.access: You will have everything you need in the house from towels to kitchen items, to high-speed internet, a printer, an office space, 2 bedrooms (with lots of privacy for each), 2 bathrooms, jacuzzi tub, Brand New washer & dryer in unit, balcony overlooking the park, new playground for the kids, restaurants, bars, art galleries, public transportation. We can arrange access at virtually any time of the day or night.
host_about.interaction: We are available by text, e-mail and phone if you would ever need anything or simply have questions about finding the best burger or a tasty brunch spot. We have many friends and family in the immediate area to help out if we are not in town.

Having spent more time than I care to remember in sterile, uninviting hotel rooms, I was initially attracted to vacation rentals as refreshing, and often more affordable, alternatives.  What I found were the same white walls and beige furniture or, even worse, cluttered rooms and Aunt Edna's donated dilapidated couch in the living room.  Well, welcome to something different.  Take a break from your busy schedule by relaxing in clean, inviting rental that that feels enough like home that you're immediately comfortable while being so special you'll look forward to your return.  Many of my guests have been back 2 or 3 times, and some have found themselves venturing across the country to check out another Red Hot Vacation Rental.  

My places are located in Chicago, Miami Beach and San Francisco. I've lived in all 3 cities and am happy to suggest hidden local gems or recommend the best nearby dry cleaner.

host_about.name: 3 bedroom Dramatic Bucktown LOFT
host_about.summary: Romantic Bucktown loft in superb location on 2 floors with 2 decks the following reviews are also for other apartments in the building and my house in umbria/tuscany. the newest pricing, photos, description and reviews are for the penthouse apartment and the place and location are spectacular.
host_about.space: Impeccably clean and well appointed one of a kind 3 Bedroom, 2 bathroom attic/loft apartment on an excellent treelined street in bucktown. This dramatic space on 2 floors has a retro /vintage /european feel with many primitive antiques and a romantic claw foot tub in the living room. Upon entering the top floor the church lights and 12 foot vaulted ceilings hover over the open space exposing the living, dining, and kitchen areas. There are wood floors throughout, completely equipped kitchen with dishwasher and a 12 foot vintage dining table that was once a folding farmers table; seating capacity more that 15 people. Direct tv with HBO and Showtime, stereo, washer/dryer, 2 balconies, wireless internet access, towels, linens, comforters and blankets Guests will have access to the entire space, aside from 3 locked closets. There are many trendy restaurants/bars/salons/cafes as well as great shopping for new, vintage and thrift all in Bucktown.  Pets ok with an extra deposit.  Prices vary

host_about.name: Andersonville - Perfect location!
host_about.summary: Recently named as one of the 10 unbelievable Airbnbs in Chicago by Thrillist.
host_about.space: We have a private bedroom available in our home in Andersonville,  a quaint neighborhood in the middle of a world-class city. The bedroom will accommodate two people very comfortably with queen bed, cable, wireless internet, with large window that brings in plenty of light. Shared bath with heated tile floors.  Our outdoor space is fantastic. If you feel like relaxing in the yard all day, that's perfect. You can enjoy your morning coffee or evening drinks on our huge deck overlooking our stream and pond.  Say hello to the fish and turtle. Our home is all access. Feel free to relax any place you feel comfortable. We work from home and love some distraction from work.  :)  Both of us enjoy sharing our time with our guests. Join us for coffee in the morning or cocktails in the evening.

host_about.name: Central guestroom! Walk everywhere!
host_about.summary: Convenient to the Magnificent Mile and the Loop, close to major 'L' metro stations, this is a comfortable guestroom in a quiet vintage building in the popular River North area.   This listing is for one bedroom of a two-bedroom apartment.  Guests sleep in the guestroom, I sleep in the other bedroom.  There is one shared bathroom. Caveats: 1) I had a cat until Oct. I may get a replacement.  Please only book if you're okay with cats 2) There is no elevator 3) No sleeping outside of the bedrooms.
host_about.space: This vintage (125 year old) River North Gallery District home is highly walkable to major (and minor) destinations downtown (a WalkScore of 98)!  Extremely convenient to transit as well (a TransitScore of 100)!  Even quite bikeable, with Divvy bike share station a half-block away (and a cycle score of 77, and I bike to work)! I have had functional, tested, carbon monoxide detectors since day one, and fully meet Chicago fire safety codes which are some of the most stringent in the country. If you have any specific questions related to safety, please don't hesitate to ask, as safety is very important to me - after all, I live here and want to be safe myself. host_about.neighborhood_overview: The part of River North my apartment is in is a short 10 minute walk to Michigan Avenue, a 15 minute walk to the Loop, and about a 3 minute walk to the nearest metro station, so it's a great launching point to explore Chicago. The blocks around my place are filled with shops, galleries and wonderful restaurants but it still manages to be quiet and relatively calm despite the proximity to so much of downtown. UPDATE: There is construction across the street.  The Airbnb guestroom is the quietest part of the apartment, though, and no guest has complained about the construction.
host_about.notes: This is a working household, so there may be occasional minor repairs.  Anything major I will give guests plenty of notice about ahead of time unless it's an emergency.  The guestroom is kept clean and tidy at all times, but the rest of the house will vary from
host_about.transit: Many popular attractions are less than a 25 minute walk from my place, but for things further afield - or to avoid walking - taxis can be easily hailed on the street and Uber and Lyft both have excellent availability in the area. For transit, my place is a 3 minute walk to the nearest Brown Line station, an 8 minute walk to the nearest Red Line station, and less than a 5 minute walk to these buses: 66/Chicago, 22/Clark, 65/Grand, 36/Broadway, 37/Sedgewick, and 156/Lasalle.  There are also many express buses that run on Michigan Avenue which is just a 10 minute walk due east of me, and a station serving every other metro line is just a 15 minute walk away.
host_about.access: As a guest, you sleep in your own private bedroom but also have access to any part of the apartment except *my* bedroom.
host_about.interaction: I live in the apartment, and I have personally met nearly all the guests from my hundreds of bookings.   Depending on each guest's and my schedules, we may only see each other heading in or out, or we may talk for hours or even share a meal.  I tend to respect guest's privacy and alone time, letting guests decide whether to initiate conversations, but I am happy to talk about Chicago or the neighborhood or travelling or almost any other subject with anyone interested in taking advantage of ready access to a local.
host_about.house_rules: 1) Make sure the apartment door is locked and shut every time you leave. 2) No sleeping outside of the guestroom.  Guests may use all the common areas, just not for sleeping.  This is for both guests' comfort and my comfort. 3) On weeknights quiet hours from 10pm-7am. 4) Please don't use the fireplace. Final and most important rule: Enjoy Chicago! Check-in times: Check-in time is flexible, but no check-ins prior to 8am.  Guests arriving before Noon will be able to drop off bags and get keys, but may not have access to the guestroom itself until after Noon (see check-out guidelines below).   Out of 500+ bookings, I've only been unable to accommodate a requested check-in time a handful of times.  However, I don't work at home so please be aware that there are occasionally limitations to my availability for checkins.  If you absolutely must drop your luggage at a specific time, please check with me prior to sending a booking request to make sure I'll be able to guarantee that I can be the
host_about.host_about:
I live in the apartment and am easy-going and respectful.  I do my best to be helpful with advice on the city and to be around to answer local questions.  

I enjoy travel, movies, playing with my cat and exploring cities - including my own, Chicago.  I grew up on the West Coast in the wine country southwest of Portland, Oregon.  I went to university in a small school in Indiana, and ended up staying in the Great Lakes region, first a couple years in Minnesota and in Chicago for the past 20+ years.  I've lived in my present place, in the River North neighborhood, for 12+ years now and really enjoy it for its close proximity to so much in the central area and excellent access to transit, while my building still manages to be quiet and peaceful.

I've traveled a fair bit myself, having visited over half of the States here in the U.S., plus Canada (Toronto), Mexico (Yucatan, Cancun, Mexico City), Panama (Panama City), Spain (Madrid, Barcelona), Puerto Rico (San Juan, Vieques, Ponce), France (Paris, Lyon), China (Beijing, Shanghai, Nanjing, Hangzhou, Hefei), Sweden (Stockholm), Switzerland (Geneva), the Netherlands (Maastricht), England (London), Austria (Vienna), Norway (Oslo, Bergen, Haugesund, Feoy), Finland (Helsinki), Turkey (Istanbul) and Russia (Moscow, Tver, Novgorod, Leningrad, Khabarovsk, Novosibirsk, Irkutsk) (was still the U.S.S.R. at the time) and Andorra.

I do work full-time outside of the home, but my office is nearby in the event of emergencies and to aid in flexible check-in times.

host_about.name: 2 Bedroom 1 Block to Fullerton L - Garage Avail
host_about.summary: Express Red line service to the Loop is 1 block away!  Resident manager in 4-unit brownstone built just after the great Fire. Tastefully furnished. Modern granite kitchen, central  heat & AC.  Warm brick walls, hardwood floors & fun neighborhood beat generic corporate rentals any day.  On a quiet side street in Lincoln Park, Chicago’s premiere neighborhood  with abundant restaurants, bars & shops. Close to the Loop, Grant Park, the lakefront. Grill on the building's deck (shared with 3 units)
host_about.space: This apartment is charming with hardwood floors and exposed brick walls, but also modern with a granite kitchen, dishwasher and central heat and A/C. host_about.interaction: If live in California, but I have an onsite manager, Ness, who can handle most issues during reasonable hours. For non-emergencies, please send a message through the system or call/text. If you are contacting me, please remember that California is 2 hours behind Chicago.

host_about.host_about:
Travel is fun and exciting but can be hard on the wallet.  It doesn't have to be that way.  Email if you have questions, especially if your requested dates are in the near term and I will do my best to work with you!

Having spent more time than I care to remember in sterile, uninviting hotel rooms, I was initially attracted to vacation rentals as refreshing, and often more affordable, alternatives.  What I found were the same white walls and beige furniture or, even worse, cluttered rooms and Aunt Edna's donated dilapidated couch in the living room.  Well, welcome to something different.  Take a break from your busy schedule by relaxing in clean, inviting rental that that feels enough like home that you're immediately comfortable while being so special you'll look forward to your return.  Many of my guests have been back 2 or 3 times, and some have found themselves venturing across the country to check out another Red Hot Vacation Rental.  

My places are located in Chicago, Miami Beach and San Francisco. I've lived in all 3 cities and am happy to suggest hidden local gems or recommend the best nearby dry cleaner.

host_about.summary: A peaceful shared space in Chicago's Ukrainian Village Neighborhood. Perfect for students and couples staying 4 days or more. Shopping, dining, nightlife, sightseeing, buses, rental bikes are all within steps from the apartment.
host_about.space: Mike, Vero (and dog Piper) live in a 3 bedroom apartment above an art studio. Your guest bedroom is located in the front of the apartment, directly outside of the living room/TV room, which has a beautiful view of our vibrant neighborhood.  The bedroom has a large storage closet, queen bed with extra sheets & towels, small table and chair for studying. There is also a larger table outside the bedroom, near the WiFi internet router, that you are welcome to use at any time to bring your laptop or just enjoy a meal and watch the neighbors walk by. The Living room, TV room, bathroom, kitchen and porch are yours to enjoy too. Just clean up any messes. Those spaces are shared with us and any other guest that stays in the second private bedroom. You'll have storage space in the kitchen and bathroom...We provide a few basic things to get you started for the first couple days of your stay.

host_about.neighborhood_overview: Ukrainian Village / West Town is a beautifully tree-lined neighborhood, with ornate churches, large historic homes, delicious food, fun bars, nightclubs, cafes, shopping...We've got maps!  Hot breakfast is available at Sunrise Cafe, which is just down the street. Also check out Feed, Dark Matter (coffee), Bite, Whisk, Roots Pizza. Lunch, Dinner and drinks are available at El Metro Cantina and The Rookery.
host_about.notes: Guests with a clear photo, complete profile and shared schedule for check-in/check-out (dates and estimated times are fine) will be given priority. Please let me know if you think you might have a problem with having a dog in the house. Please note: Piper is still a happy, playful and curious dog (especially with unattended shoes), so I do ask all guests to just keep the bedroom doors closed. Overnight visitors that do not book through Airbnb are not allowed.
host_about.transit: Buses and rental bikes are just across the street! It's easy to ride the #66 Chicago Avenue bus or #50 Damen avenue bus to any train stop from O'Hare or Midway Airport, Navy Pier or Downtown. It's only a 15-20 minute walk to Wicker Park/Bucktown's Music and dining district, The new 606 Bloomdale (Biking/Walking)Trail and the Blue line train to O'hare airport/downtown. Of course, taxis and uber rides are around, but ask about my $20 LYFT discount. (MIKELMT)
host_about.access: When the weather allows, the back terrace is a wonderful place that most guests just love to hangout and read a book or just watch the neighborhood in action.  You'll have your own kitchen storage and shelf in the refrigerator for any personal groceries...all guests are welcome to make food in the kitchen, We just ask that you clean up after each meal. Let me know if you have a regular bathroom schedule during the week.
host_about.interaction: We love suggesting places to go and would be happy to hangout if you would like to trade stories and experiences. Veronica is available at her restaurant  one block away) during the week if an emergency comes up, or you just need some yummy Mexican food. Mike works mostly nights and weekends as a Massage Therapist ( just a few blocks away also), so you'll have a lot of private time to relax or play with Piper if you want.  We walk Piper every few hours during the day (occasionally hire a walker) and keep her in our bedroom overnight...please let me know if she gets in your way and I may make arrangements for her to be in daycare for a couple days.

host_about.neighborhood_overview: Uptown  is considered the most diverse neighborhood in Chicago. There are a wide range of ethnic restaurants within walking distance to the apartment - Ethiopian, Indian, Mexican, Nigerian, Sushi, Thai, and Vietnamese. The Uptown Entertainment District is home to various music venues, nightclubs, restaurants and theatres. The famous Green Mill Jazz Club, which offers jazz 7 days a week, is 4 blocks from the apartment. Uptown is also a stop for Chicago Gangster tours, with many locations tied to infamous gangsters such as John Dillinger, and Al Capone. As in any big city, it is important to beware of your surroundings when walking at night. Uptown is a great location for jazz buffs, people who like to run, ride a bike and that needs access to tourist sites while not be in the middle of them.  The apartment is walking distance to Lincoln Park and Lake Michigan. It is a 5 minute walk to the running/bike path and 10 minutes to the beach. There is a DIVVY bike rental available 1/2 block awa
host_about.notes: I've hosted guests from 2 nights to 6 months.
host_about.transit: Transportation The CTA express bus stop to downtown is 1/2 block away and will get you to WaterTower Place in 25 minutes. The Red Line Lawrence stop is 3 blocks away, which will get you to Wrigley field in 15 minutes and downtown in 25 minutes.. Bus options include express routes on Lake Shore Drive and routes that will get you anywhere in the city.
